basics.name: Robbie Mackay
basics.label: Director of Engineering | Tech Lead | Software Developer
basics.summary: I have 10+ years of experience building full stack web apps, with a focus on non profits and companies with a social purpose. I currently lead the development team at [Ushahidi](https://www.ushahidi.com). I've been working remotely for the last 5 years, and managing a distributed team for 1.5 years.

work.summary: Ushahidi is a non profit building open source software for the advocacy, development, and humanitarian response communities.
highlights: Led a distributed team of developers in multiple time zones
Set technical direction for Ushahidi's products (Ushahidi and RollCall)
Improved development process to bring clarity and efficiency
Built a healthy code review and testing culture
Implemented basic people management (1-1s, reviews) in a historically flat anti-management organization
Implemented sane process for goal setting

work.summary: I joined Ushahidi to lead development of client projects and
highlights: Led the development of Ushahidi's mapping and data gathering tool
Launched rebuild and SaaS edition of Ushahidi
Lead developer on Ushahidi projects for [Internews](http://internews.org), [WorldVision](http://worldvision.org) and [APC](http://apc.org/)
Contact point for security issues

work.summary: Torchbox is a digital agency building websites and applications for people trying to make the world a better place. I worked primarily on developing Drupal based websites for charity/non profit clients.
highlights: Developed complex Drupal based sites for charities and non-profit organisations
Led development of new website for [UK Green Building Council](http://www.ukgbc.org/)

Led development of global website for [ActionAid](http://actionaid.org/), and many country offices. This handled high traffic and used geoip sniff and nginx caching to intelligently serve different content based on region.
Built automation tools for creating standardised Drupal deployments

work.summary: Greenpeace is a global campaigning organization working to protect the environment and promote peace. I was the sole web developer maintaining campaigning websites and other hardware or web tools as needed
highlights: Developed and maintained a large Drupal site for Sign On climate change campaign in the run up to [COP15](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2009_United_Nations_Climate_Change_Conference)
Built apps to show live social media feeds during direct actions and protests, when under high load from public and media
Ran basic technical training for (potential) activists

work.summary: I worked as a freelance software developer and occasionally designer. I built custom web apps and brochure sites for various clients, often based on Silverstripe CMS.
highlights: Developed web apps and brochure site for various clients
Developed custom web applications based on Silverstripe CMS

work.summary: Genesis Interactive is a small web development shop. I worked as a developer over summer.
highlights: Introduced version control and bug tracking, and trained other developers to use them
Built a stock and inventory tracking component for Genesis' customer relations management (CRM) product
Developed web apps and websites for clients

work.summary: Navman produces in-car GPS systems. I worked in the Testing team as a summer job while studying.
highlights: Acceptance testing on car navigation software and hardware
Wrote test cases for new handsfree kit product lines

volunteer.summary: Managed Web and IT needs for Engineers Without Borders NZ
highlights: Web and IT Manager for Engineers Without Borders NZ
Managed the website content and platform (Drupal CMS)
Developed online payment (donation) and membership system
Member of the founding committee for Engineers Without Borders NZ
